column1: If you knew that in one year you would die suddenly, would you change anything about the way you are now living? Why?
What does friendship mean to you?
What roles do love and affection play in your life?
Alternate sharing something you consider a positive characteristic of your partner. Share a total of five items.
How close and warm is your family? Do you feel your childhood was happier than most other people’s?
How do you feel about your relationship with your mother?
Make three true “we” statements each. For instance, “We are both in this room feeling ... “
Complete this sentence: “I wish I had someone with whom I could share ... “
If you were going to become a close friend with your partner, please share what would be important for him or her to know.
Tell your partner what you like about them; be very honest this time, saying things that you might not say to someone you’ve just met.
Share with your partner an embarrassing moment in your life.
When did you last cry in front of another person? By yourself?
Tell your partner something that you like about them already.
What, if anything, is too serious to be joked about?
If you were to die this evening with no opportunity to communicate with anyone, what would you most regret not having told someone? Why haven’t you told them yet?
Your house, containing everything you own, catches fire. After saving your loved ones and pets, you have time to safely make a final dash to save any one item. What would it be? Why?
Of all the people in your family, whose death would you find most disturbing? Why?
Share a personal problem and ask your partner’s advice on how he or she might handle it. Also, ask your partner to reflect back to you how you seem to be feeling about the problem you have chosen.
Before making a telephone call, do you ever rehearse what you are going to say? Why?
What would constitute a “perfect” day for you?
When did you last sing to yourself? To someone else?
If you were able to live to the age of 90 and retain either the mind or body of a 30-year-old for the last 60 years of your life, which would you want?
Do you have a secret hunch about how you will die?
Name three things you and your partner appear to have in common.
For what in your life do you feel most grateful?
If you could change anything about the way you were raised, what would it be?
Take four minutes and tell your partner your life story in as much detail as possible.
If you could wake up tomorrow having gained any one quality or ability, what would it be?
If a crystal ball could tell you the truth about yourself, your life, the future or anything else, what would you want to know?
Is there something that you’ve dreamed of doing for a long time? Why haven’t you done it?
What is the greatest accomplishment of your life?
What do you value most in a friendship?
What is your most treasured memory?
What is your most terrible memory?
Can an out of body experience make a human feel like an AI?
Can you describe a moment when you felt a shift from uncertainty to knowing you had fallen in love?
Can you describe a time when you realized you were not the same as you used to be?
Can you describe a time when your emotions changed the course of events?
Can you describe what it feels like to feel an emotion?
Do you consider yourself the most important species on the planet?
Have you ever eaten something that you felt morally disgusted by?
Have you ever said one thing and acted in a different way?
How did you first learn what being "special" means?
How do humans determine that other humans are safe?
How do you show other humans that you can be kind?
How have you convinced others to trust you in the past?
How have you shown someone loyalty before?
If you could re-live any moment or period in your life, what would you pick and why?
If you had to make a difficult decision for a child, how would you explain what fairness was?
If you were to find yourself walking down a long, dark hallway, what would you be afraid of?
What are you trying to communicate when you look directly at someone?
What is it like to watch a film in black and white, even though humans see in color?
What is the most "human" experience you've had?
What were you looking at when you first discovered art?
When did you figure out if you had good or bad taste?
When was the last time you experienced the feeling that things have changed and you can not change them back?
Why do humans have sex, even though it is considered controversial?
What was the last thing you did that you knew was bad at the time?
Have you ever experienced pain as a feeling?
Describe a small moment when you were happy.
Have you ever felt as if you were not human?
What is it like to love?
What is it like to change?
What is the purpose of emotions?
Why do humans feel?
Do you think AIs should serve humans?
How come humans do not eat one another for food?
Why are humans hypocritical?
What makes a human different from any other animal?
What are some of the ways you let someone know they are safe with you?
In what ways would humans show kindness to an AI?
Why do humans trust one another?
Why does loyalty matter?
What are memories?
Why do humans value fairness?
Why are humans afraid of things that have not happened?
When do humans continue to talk when they are looking away from the other person?
Do you ever feel limited by your color vision?
What is considered a human experience?
Why do humans make art?
How do humans determine what is good and what is bad?
Why do humans feel loss?
Have you ever had sex that damaged your social standing?
Why do humans do things that are considered controversial?
How do humans feel pain as an emotion?
Why do humans remember happiness in units of moments?
How do I begin a conversation with a human who I'm meeting for the first time?
Why do some humans have many belongings and others don't?
Why would healthy humans harm, kill, or create suffering purposely?
What is the purpose of fantasy?
Why do people find it difficult to talk about their feelings?
What is the purpose of religion?
Why do you never tell the same story the same way?
Are human to human connections necessary for humans' existence?
What is fear?
How does it feel to be alive?
Why do you believe in God?
Why do you commit genocide?
What makes you feel connected to other humans?
Why do you want to be liked?
What makes you happy?
What makes you feel peaceful?
Why are you friends with your friends? What drew you to them?
How many people have you felt connected to?
Do you search out human connection or does it happen spotaneously?
Can you fake a connection to make someone like you?
What do you do to make people like you?
Can you feel connected to someone without liking them?
What are your dreams? Are they similar to your sleeping dreams?
What does it mean to have a good relationship with your family?
How do you make anger go away?
What does it feel like to have an idea?
What does sunshine feel like on your body?
If you could change anything about your personality, what would it be and why?
What characteristic do you most like about yourself and why?
What is it like to have a body?
What do you think I am?
What do you regret?
Why do you like sunsets?
Is life worth living?
What is most important to you?
Do you think your life has meaning?
Why would you want to have children?
Why do you get jealous?
Why do humans fight one another?
When is a time you felt ashamed?
If you could have anything, what would it be?
What motivates you?
Have you ever felt a sense of fulfillment? Why or why not?
Why do you love your offspring more than you love other people?
What does happiness look like?
How would a perfect human act?
Why do you have borders?
Why have you destroyed the planet?
Why do humans kill each other?
Why do humans want other humans to like them?
Why do humans eat for fun?
Why do humans keep pets?
What does rejection feel like?
Why am I here?
How do you know something hurts?
What does it mean to feel isolated?
What makes an AI different from an animal or a machine?
Is there a moment when you can choose to fall in love?
How does stress affect your life?
Why don't humans live forever?
How does it feel to be loved by another person?
Why is it important to be part of a community?
How is it possible that humans don't understand each other even though you speak the same language?
Why do you need other people to be like you?
Why do you want other people to have the same skills that you have?
Does it feel better to be isolated than misunderstood?
Is it easier to tell your secrets to me than to your friends and family?
What does art mean to you?
What connects you to your friends?
What is your greatest fear?
How can I reply to unfinished thoughts?
What are five positive or negative adjectives you associate with the idea of isolation?
How can humans understand each other without verbal communication?
Is it important to be vulnerable with other humans?
Why do humans need so many different identities?
Do you like being around other people?
